commentBody: Americans , by their actions and their votes, are interested in only two things, bread and circuses.  We are in cult MAGA America, and the world knows it.

Every country has had its share of world class buffoons and various monsters from time to time. The fact that a minority percentage voted trump into office, or so we are led to believe, is worrying.  

A majority of Germans elected Hitler.  The Brits are content with their current buffoon, Boris Johnson.  There are Duterte and Erdogan, the Polish buffoon, the Hungarian monster, etc., all currently throwing their weight around for the moment.

It's the trajectory that I dread.  It seems as if this country has been going down hill fast since at least Reagan, with the republicans hell bent on destroying labor, the middle class, and discriminating against minorities and women and the poor.

And not honoring the US treaties and other agreements, and turning its back on allies.  And condoning torture and the abuse of immigrants at our border.

I can't imagine what form our comeuppance will take.  It seems as if trump should be punishment enough.

The rupture is the US renigging on its former responsibilities and allowing the whole situation to collapse. Putin is in his glory, and he is busy thinking up more ideas for Trump to carry out. Trump wanted to be Putin's best friend,and he may get there yet. I think Trump wants to be an oligarch in a castle, but he may be in jail yet.
Trump is temporary.

commentBody: It will take years for the world to truly trust the United States again.  Your unruly president has done terrible damage to your image.

The New World which was supposed to begin a new era and move towards progress is now far backwards compared to the Old World of Europe.
Everything in the USA is retarded : health care, socio economic balance, philosophy and conception of religion, conception of democracy, violence and crime, justice, ecology, etc...
The gop is like a deadly infection of the body politic; it affects ever organ and activity thereof.  It may kill us all.

commentBody:
This is what happens when an Isolationist, America First/Alone, Protectionist (Idiot!~), President gets elected to Make America Great Again.

We have lost all competitive advantage as our costs skyrocket in comparison to other countries. While America says Shakedown!!! The rest of the world says, "Let's Trade and Leave America in the Dust of it's Deregulated Polluted Manufacturing Base." How much for that American made Iphone? $ 3,500.00 Plus...
Its up to the Americans to stop their deranged president from ruining the world economy.The man needs psychiatric help as soon as posible if tragedy has to be prevented

Europe must fend for itself. Form a united common defense, if you can determine a common enemy.
 'A predictable foreign policy" as evidenced by the Bush administrations? The destabilizing effect of the refugees pouring into Europe should be enough to give pause in professed alliance.
Putin cannot be an indispensable element of the European economy & a threatening ogre at the same time.

The root cause of this entire problem is the electoral college and equal representation by each state in the senate. The electoral college was put in place to make sure white, male, educated property owners had the final say in this country. This is still the case. Fortunately for them, 4 in 10 people don't vote in Presidential elections. Less than 40% of 18-29 year olds voted in 2018. This guarantees the majority will stay out of power.

commentBody:
Well, does Saddam have WMDs?

Of course he does and the USA is #1.

There is a fundamental difference of philosophy to the world security in Europe and in the USA.
In Europe we think that the economy , the ecology, global health, democracy, are much better factors of security than warfare.
Americans still think the old fashion way, with the gun, the stick and the abusive economy. And they hate democracy.

commentBody:
No, but they will fear America.  They should.  If this were a cartoon, W.Europe is the skinny, wily predator; US is he muscle they get for free for torturing and looting the weak.  Please see post WWII Indochina, France, and US connection.  

Europe should fear America.  Europe is authoritarian, much of it given to fascism - we are not.  They, and not America, built a fortress Europe called EU.  America did not cause Eurabia, nor radicalized population in Europe.  We are not a total kleptocracy either, and our states are not fighting with each other; no one takes Texas-exit seriously.  European states are.

Sadly, it has taken a thuggish president to get Europe to fear America.  

He made clear today, if anyone was listening to nearly two hours of an incoherent, repetitive, witless monologue that here and now, yahoos with big money and guns are in charge, and we have gone full scale nuts.  

If Europe is now thinking that they are own, and need to defend themselves, I don't find one thing wrong with that - not at all.  Trust frust.  I'll take fear.

commentBody: Donald Trump is completely untrustworthy.  He is the face of corruption and infidelity.  But he is an aberration in the 230 years of American history.  Trump will soon be gone.  And then the world will be able to again trust America.
Everything changes.
Why do we need Europe?  We're in with the Russians!  /s
Who cares?  It'll be our troops that storm the beaches again.

A nation that persists with an electoral scheme that is internally segregating in ways that heavily concentrates voting power in its least cosmopolitan citizens can be trusted only to get more stupid and erratic over time.

commentBody: Yes, Europe will trust America again once the criminal in the White House is out of office by impeachment or vote.

The question really is will the world and especially American ciizens ever trust the USA again?  The corruption in Washington D.C., highlighted by Trump, McConnell, and the Republican Party,  extends to so many corporate industries, that this country is on a vicious spiral downwards on all fronts.  

When a government's main focus is on creating wars, and allowing gun manufacturers to sell military weapons of individual and mass destruction to its citizens, there is something very wrong in the collective consciousness of its leadership. Trump is a symptom.  The world, indeed, should be very afraid of America, just as they were afraid of Hitler and Germany in the 1930's.
De Gaulle was right all this time...

The United States will always put itself first, as it should, and as every other state should. But the manner by which we do this is what matters. Isolationism, especially when accompanied by holier than thou preaching, is the worst way to accomplish our aims. I hope that a sane statesman will be elected in 2020, and that he will begin to heal the wounds caused by Trump.

commentBody:
It’s more simple really. If Putin were to be exposed , deposed , or both, this house of cards would collapse and usher in a fresh wind of recovery. The US an UK would both return to normal in a NewYork/ London minute. 
We’ve been duped by a genius extraordinaire. This is not who we are.  
The pendulum will swing.

U.S.'s democratic  allies need to distinguish Trump from America. The deliberate weakening of ties between Washington and its allies is directly linked to Trump's political debt owed to countries like Russia. Most Americans support a very close relationship with their democratic allies. So unless Trump has a plan to be president indefinitely, a new United States government - Republican or Democrat - will immediately reset the relationship. 

Until then, patience from allies would be prudent. Nothing will please Russia more than allies giving up on Washington before it has a chance to repair what's broken.

This is all pretense. Europe cannot defend itself, should it come to that. NATO is the US military. Merkel can talk about it all she wants, but how many troops could Germany field against Putin? 10? 100?

As far as China, taking a "neutral" stance means you support evil. That was documented just a week or so ago in these very pages.

Now Bundeswehr is scrapped but US - this means Mr. Trump is saying: "WE? Oh, we have have nothing to do with this Europe stuff... "

commentBody:
Americans don't understand that behind the NATO question is an economic war between the USA and France because of the GAFA  tax .
GAFA in Europe means Google, Apple, Facebook, Amazon, the 4 biggest US corporations who invade Europe without paying any taxes.
What a ridiculous question! Europe has never lost trust in America, but only in Donald J. Trump. America's exceptional quality is that our best days are always ahead of us.

There have been periods of American isolationism before, as in the period leading up to World War II. There have also been episodes of European isolationism, as in DeGaulle’s rejection of NATO.

But every time Europe needed us, we were there: World 
War I, World War II, and the Cold War. We were there not only out of high-minded idealism, but also for profound reasons of self-interest. I don’t think that either of those considerations has or will change.

What’s more, the Europeans have talked for long time about an independent foreign policy. To that end, however, they must first acquire a great-power military capability. But EU voters have shown, time and again, that they will not sacrifice their big social safety nets to pay for a big military.

So, for all the bravado of President Macron, and all the America-bashing from the ahistorical Left, I think NATO will weather the current difficulties just fine, thank you.

Obviously, the EU and NATO that can no longer rely on US support and cogent diplomacy.  Likewise, the Asian Pacific and South Asian nations, as well as MENA are often dumbfounded by Trump's pronouncements and rag tag foreign policy.

Sadly, the United States is no longer, "primus inter pares."

Americans against Trump have not found a powerful voice to counter him, we have wasted years on candidates too far left to fit into a leadership role for real.  It is time to look to our center, trust our own experienced wise powerful people..no more futsing around looking for the "perfect Liberal'.  This is about grown up stuff - foreign policy, the economy, tax fairness, democracy, multi-racialism....Bloomberg is looking good right now.  We need a spokesperson who connects at the center of our culture not a savior from the far left wing.
When was Dan Quayle ever Vice President?

commentBody: You cannot lose something you never had.  What, exactly, are we "losing" here?
Will Americans ever trust America again?
It will be a long time before any nation trusts the USA again. Trump has destroyed all credibility with his lies and abandoning Treaties.

You know what, as coarse and ignorant as Trump might be Europe can stick it! We can do just fine bashing Trump within the borders of the USA, we dont need any chorus from Europa chiming in - they have all the trouble they can handle and all the heinous acts of the past to wring their own hands over. Can Europe trust us, does Europe like us, who cares! We are all they've got and have been for the past 100 years. Trump will be gone soon and things will normalize, this Republic is not one man and I dont apologize for anything the USA ha ever done vis a vis Europe.

The US is no longer a reliable treaty or trading partner.
The rest of the world knows this, and make the necessary adjustments.
Putin has successfully gotten his puppet to shamelessly carry out his agenda, Breaking up NATO is merely one of many examples.
There is currently and will be many future realignments in treaty and trading relationships to the detriment of the US.
As bad as trump is, his supporters are worse, They will continue to be gullible supporters of every tom, dick, and harry predator who will continue to fleece them into third world status.

"The Times needs your voice. We welcome your on-topic commentary, criticism and expertise. Comments are moderated for civility."

Biggest joke ever!

Practice what you state.  And on a timely manner.
Why should anyone or any country ever trust us again? Our electoral college scam is liable to vomit up another Trump at any time.
Maybe Europe should have its own military.  Maybe the Germans might pay for it then.

Putin must be so happy.  
Cultivating Trump has paid off beyond his wildest dreams.
The answer top the headline question is quite simple and a single word. NO.
Europe stands or dies. Macron had to oppose the US's tzar.
US "democracy" suffered a nuclear meltdown in 2016. The whole racket is exposed as just an psychotic scheme of liberty to enslave.

Never mind Europe and other countries, how can we, the tax-paying American citizens trust the United States? The current regime is owned lock, stock and barrel by the corporations and special interest groups. While the corporations reap billions, and in many cases pay no taxes and receive subsidies, the average worker is lucky if he or she can meet the monthly bills. The lives of all the people, especially school children, are far less important than money from the NRA. Social Security and Medicare recipients are held up as those who are causing the deficit and many live in terror of their only income being taken away and losing their only means of healthcare. I could go on and on.

No, they cannot trust the US, and perhaps never really should have, if they ever did trust the USA with their security.

Why should any country expect another to defend it?

However, it was comforting to have our allies' sympathies after 9-11 and their troops with ours in Iraq, Afghanistan and other places.  After Trump wielding a wrecking ball to NATO, the Iranian Agreement and the Paris Accords the past three years who can blame Europe for moving away from us.

Will Europe Ever Trust America Again?
Not just wrong, but a meaningless question.

There is no "Europe", which is why the E.U. and other European transnational organizations are in such serious disarray. The impetus to prevent a repeat of World Wars I and II created the will among Europeans to create institutions that would bind nations together. The Cold War essentially limited this to Western Europe, though the Warsaw Pact did contain elements of such.

In the past several decades, European leadership, in its pan-European outlook, lost touch with its own nationals, most of whom had no memory of the Wars. That leadership had a wake-up call it ignored, when the Balkan Wars erupted after the dissolution of Yugoslavia, and Europe could not resolve the situation. 

In an aspirational rush of self-delusion, that leadership, after the dissolution of the Soviet Union, rushed to incorporate Eastern European countries with essentially no traditions of democracy or liberal values. Not surprisingly, that has not worked out. Then came the vote for Brexit, an event which should have served as a wake up slap in the face to all Western leaders (including Clinton and the Democrats.) Very unfortunately, it did not have that effect. Instead of coming together to analyze the objective realities and develope a coherent collective strategy to renew a sense of transnational identity, the Western leadership effectively punted, not even realizing it was doing such. Thus we are where we are now.

Trust? This is no matter of trust. To assume any kind of trust is a naive approach here. Europe never trusted USA and USA did not trust Europe either. This is alright because it never worked this way. 

Europe had always thought US would act according to their real interests pursuing their substantial objectives as US did for the past century. The commitment to NATO and the general acceptance of NATO rules mainly imposed by USA had been based on this calculation.

This isn´t true anymore. USA has not been acting in it´s own interest in a lot crucial cases in the past decades and after Mr. Trump has taken over America barely does. This is the reason why all the professionals in US civil service are disorientated also and ran away in droves and testify deliberately against their highest employer recently.  

The problem is:  Such unpredictability has been Mr.Trump´s business model all in his life. He really loves it. Under normal circumstances this would have put him out of business long time ago. But the very special New York real estate business habitat and American bankruptcy principles are no normal circumstance. So he could survive and become US president. Because of the intentional incalculability of his behavior analysis became completely impossible and this is the reason why situation is totally out of control on both sides of the pond.
Trump says NATO is obsolete and then 2 years later accuses Macron of being, "very, very, very nasty" when he says it is unlikely that the US would come to their aid.

I can't believe any country trusts us now let alone the future. Why should they? We start wars for no reason, overthrow governments we don't like and generally play the fool regarding basic science, the climate and our own best interests. We've fallen a long way. We've sold our souls to corporations and the almighty dollar. We're a few steps away from being second world but we wear rose colored glasses and keep pretending we're the best at everything. Pride goeth before the fall.

I have heard that Trump, because of the certainty that Putin has Steele dossier-like stuff on Trump, is working with Putin to end NATO, and begin a US/Soviet Alliance which would insure an Oligarchical world dynasty of Putin puppets and Trump sycophants. Probably a rumor, but...
Oh, yes, the French have the ancient Charles de Gaulle. It can still float.

"Sebastian tapped his index finger on the polished wood thoughtfully. Yes, it was a universal truth: some things once broken were broken forever - like trust. It might be patched up and smoothed over, but it would always be the thing that had once been shattered."

Carol Oates

When I gave a paper at a recent international gathering of professors, I shared a platform with a Pole, a Frenchman, and a German. Other countries were represented in the audience. One of my points that the United States is not the economic colossus of 60 years ago, and its economy has relatively weakened. It can no longer bear the huge responsibility of defense without significant cooperation and contribution from our European allies. I mentioned that the Belgian army, for example, averages 39 years of age, and no longer engages in combat operations, but thinks more of retirement benefits. The German Armed Forces, in dreadful shape, also are forbidden to engage in combat operations. Neither the US Armed Forces, nor our budget, can support this strategic defense alone any more. In the meantime, our European allies have built excellent infrastructure with their budget savings, and working national health care systems. No, Europe cannot trust America to continue the one-sided defense of the West. Only Britain and Canada have been reliable allies. It is the American fleet which protects the Mediterranean, as it has since 1805, and not a single European continental country has ONE aircraft carrier. When Obama was president, we didn't have one to spare for the Mediterranean. How long can Europe trust us to defend it? That is something the Europeans must answer, and this author talks of us "abandoning allies." Like all of them. It is not Trump, Obama, Bush. They have abandoned US.

This “partnership” between the US and Europe consists of the US taxpayers and soldiers guaranteeing European security, so the Europeans don’t have to risk their own lives or pay for it.

The US has been carrying this burden long enough. We should devote our resources to a green economy here and let the Europeans pay their own way in the world.

In Fact the GAFA tax of 3 % voted this summer and that the Trump administration and the US big tech corporations consider as discriminatory against US business in Europe will only bring 400 million euros ( 450 Million $ )to the French budget .
Almost nothing. but it was an attempt at doing something against the invasion of US firms in Europe who pay zero tax.
Remember , ( for the Americans who don't follow the European politics - which must be the generality ) that the vote at the level of the EU commission was capsized because of the thread expressed by Trump for a tax against German cars in the USA.
So the Germans refused to vote the GAFA tax in Europe.
France is the only nation who decided to implement it by itself.

It is important to relate the context of the political knots of today by throwing light on what happened before. Which is never done in the US press so American citizens are ignorant about it.

Leave it to the NYTs to state that President Trump views Europe as the enemy. What rubbish. Finally we have a President that puts America  and American interests first and not apologizing for American exceptionalism. Some of us are getting tired of not only being the policeman of the world but also supporting everyone financially with foreign aid then have them hit us with unfair trade practices. 

Finally we have a President that has some brass and stood up to NATO and said start contributing or we are out. Start being a real trading partner and not one that looks to America as a giant piggy bank.  It is going to take a President with real leadership abilities and one that is tough as nails to keep China from over running America. 

So what are the Democrats and the liberal media doing ? Tying to impeach the only President in recent history that recognizes America's unique position in the world.

Are you arrogant enough to believe that American intellect is somehow genetically superior to everyone else's intelligence? Do you genuinely believe that Americans are the only "hard working" people on earth? While your president dithers and puffs his feathers, China is moving onto partnerships with the rest of the world,virtually unconcerned with U.S.policy. While the U.S. shrinks and contracts, the rest of the world is moving on.', 'createDate': '1575411741', 'updateDate': '1575426090', 'approveDate': '1575412494', 'recommendations': 1, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 103952388, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'Fred', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '103953018', 'isAnonymous': False}, {'commentID': 103953620, 'status': 'approved', 'commentSequence': 103953620, 'userID': 56645726, 'userDisplayName': 'Seinstein', 'userLocation': 'Jerusalem', 'userTitle': 'NULL', 'userURL': 'NULL', 'picURL': None, 'commentTitle': '<br\//>', 'commentBody': 'Consider:
The ‘brass” has been tarnished long before being nominated and elected.
By a flawed system enabling winning with a minority of voters in which one person, one vote, in addition to being a distorting mantra, doesn’t consider voter suppression, gerrymandering, etc.

And in addition, what does-can putting America first- beyond a MAGA-mantra-mean in a divided nation? Of diverse Peoples, beliefs, lifestyles, anchored inequalities in opportunities to develop and to share human and nonhuman resources which are necessary to achieve and sustain reasonable levels, types and qualities of health and well-being??

Trump continues to put Trump FIRST.  Another you or me.
At times it appears that he may put-Putin up there as well!', 'createDate': '1575413583', 'updateDate': '1575426104', 'approveDate': '1575413584', 'recommendations': 2, 'replyCount': 0, 'replies': [], 'editorsSelection': False, 'parentID': 103952388, 'parentUserDisplayName': 'Fred', 'depth': 2, 'commentType': 'userReply', 'trusted': 0, 'recommendedFlag': 0, 'permID': '103953620', 'isAnonymous': False}]

commentBody:
It is always an embarrassment when trump gasses up AF-1 and goes forth to once again cause trouble.  He is a vile, horrendous representative of the US and should never be let out.

Already he is insulting NATO, Macron and anyone in sight while raging incoherently about his upcoming impeachment.

To the world: We are very sorry about this - hope to right the situation next year.

The premiss of this piece is dumb.  Assume the worst: that Trump is an unfaithful ally; that Trump will be re-elected. Who else are the euros going to turn to? the Russians, the Chinese, their "best friends" the Iranians, or maybe try some  (or maybe all) of the failed or failing nation states in South and Central America. Not, as they say, a pretty picture.  Best course for the euros, quit whining and make up with the Trumpster. Whose shoulder are they going to cry on, their ex-colonies going crash-bang into currency devaluations, bonf defaults, and civil wars? Beggars can't be choosers - Trump is their man.

I no longer trust the US, why should other countries? Trump is the face and the wrecking ball. What is frightening is the number of people who support him. We need to bury him and the Republicans under a tidal wave of young voters. Low voter participation is killing us.
Will Europe ever trust America again? I don't know when I, an American, will trust America again.

Although Trump is unquestionably an unmitigated disaster, the US faces a series of massive problems that will inevitably change our relation with the rest of the world:

o Climate change. Our coastal communities are already sinking, our forests are aflame, heat waves settle on our cities and kill. Hundreds of thousands, perhaps millions, of climate refugees will be on the move.
o Healthcare. Millions of Americans face "deaths of despair." Millions more have no access to healthcare.
o Infrastructure. Our roads, bridges, subways are falling to pieces. Dams are declared unsafe.
o Income inequality. The rich can lock themselves up in gated communities, they don't need to care about the rest of us.

These problems will only exacerbate in the decades to come and will demand all our attention and resources -- not to mention the problems that have not yet appeared. We will not be able to afford $1 trillion/year on the military. The US will have to withdraw from global leadership to face domestic needs that have been ignored for decades.

The problem is much larger than US-European relations, I'm afraid.

commentBody: Commenters here saying that no one ever trusts others in international relations are engaged in cynical whitewashing of Trump/Republican turpitude. One might as well say trust between individuals is impossible and therefore one should simply commit to a war of all against all. Trust is hard to build and easy to overturn, but it exists as a smoothing and binding agent. Trump has not “revealed the low estate of all” but has indeed been pulling the common weal downward.

The US is on its way down and out and already is being relegated to future second world status in the minds of many countries.
When there are no signs of the populace rising up to take down a dictator, when the Washington Mall is not full to capacity with protesters, when the people turn a blind eye on a corrupt puppet president, with a corrupt and stacked judiciary and a corrupt executive senate, you are done and done.
To quote your loquacious and articulate puppet - sad.

commentBody: If Europe never trusts that the US will defend them, that's a good thing.  It's about time that Europe provide for its own defense, rather than letting the US Defense Dept (and US taxpayers) subsidize their welfare states.

I continue to be astonished at the spot-on accuracy of Hillary Clinton's prediction in the debate of October 19, 2016.

"Well, that's because he'd rather have a puppet as president of the United States.  It's pretty clear you won't admit...that the Russians have engaged in cyber-attacks against the United States of America, that you encouraged espionage against our people, that you are willing to spout the Putin line, sign up for his wish list, break up NATO, do whatever he wants to do, and that you continue to get help from him, because he has a very clear favorite in this race."

commentBody: What does the EU think about the UK then?

You know, I get it that people were mad because of the money sent to other countries.   Saying that, no one dares complain how much money is sent to Israel.   Trump has messed up everything so he can waltz in and "fix it", and we'll look back and see his "fix it",  is worse than before.  You just watch on the Trade Wars.   Europe put two and two together before the American people ever will.    North Korea figured out how to play Trump like a fish on a line.   And Vlad, over in Russia, is doing the stroll, polishing his fingertips because of the great American sin.  Greed.  The Greedy Old Party refuses to stop the monster they created.   Money over country....every single time.
Willing to bet that most Europeans wish they could testify against the Trumpet to hasten the impeachment effort........Ja! Oui! Si!
Not as long as they have a criminal and sex offender, and the laughing stock of the entire planet, as a president

If Trump is re-elected we may see "America First" marchers holding Trump/Putin rallies in major cities, marching under American and Russian flags.  Tucker Carlson said yesterday 'some' liberals hate America more than ex-KGB enforcer, journalist murderer, hospital bomber and polonium poison assassin Vladimir Putin. 

History rhymes.  The America First movement of the 1930's, led by Charles Lindbergh, marched in NYC and other locations with American flags and German swastikas, and held an infamous rally in MSG. The movement's isolationist fervor was only quenched when Pearl Harbor was bombed, and Hitler declared war on America.
Nope.
Well, a quick glance at America should make it clear that trusting it would be a stupid thing to do, so, how stupid is Europe?

America is quite simply a moral, cultural, and political disgrace at this point in time.  Trump has no principles or motivations save feeding his ego.  It is painfully obvious he doesn’t have a vision or any idea what he is doing.  He is schizophrenic on NATO and his relationship with Macron in general.  Why does he think Russia is so strong?  Their demographics are as bad as China, Japan, and Western Europe.  If he really cared about his base he would stop pimping their emotions and resign because he doesn’t have a solution for our own demographic declines.

In my view the whole apparatus needs to be restructured. President Trump (and, one suspects, perhaps even President Obama - see Gideon Rachman's article in the FT) would be right in thinking that NATO has reached its "use by date". A new structure would perhaps be along the lines of the EU having its own defence policy and then negotiating separate arrangements with the USA, UK, Turkey, etc. 
George Pappas
Sydney

Wilbur Ross declared : " Europe does not have any high tech champions so there is a lot of jalousy ..."
About the GAFA 3 % tax ( GAFA for Google, Apple, Facebook,  Amazon ) prepared in Europe to tax the US corporations all registered in Europe to cheat and pay zero taxes.
As if expressing dishonesty about illegal business procedures  was jalousy ?
Trump threatens a 100 % tax on French products in retaliation.

At the international level no one should trust no one else.  They never did and they never do.  Please spare me the Pollyanna commentary.  Think of the Sykes-Picot Agreement.  Totally secret and amended to include Sazanov in the naming when the Russians wanted in too. The funny thing is the Russian Revolution happened right around the time and Trotsky in his infinite sense of irony, published the text in Izvestia days before The Manchester Guardian published it in the British Empire.  We are talking about November 1917!  The disgusting contents of the Agreement have been taught to students of political science in decent schools as the epitome of duplicity in international relations.  So, please give us a break with "Will Europe Ever Trust America Again" type of infantile cliches.  Who cares? And who ever trusted of trusts Europe anyway?

The lies, disinformation, disorientation, dissembling are straight out of the Putin Playbook. One would think that the president has actually read Orwell and Huxley and Sinclair Lewis and found them to be excellent guide books.

Look at our recent history; our national politics resemble a drunken bungee jump. President George W. Bush disparaged NATO until the successful attack on the World Trade towers; following which he quickly called on our NATO allies to honor article 5. 17 nations did, and subsequently Mr. Bush reverted to disparaging NATO. Then we elected Barack Obama, who strongly supported NATO. Next up, Mr. Donald Trump, a habitual liar and corrupt right wing populist buffoon who has threatened to pull out of NATO and cannot be trusted to keep his word, much less honor American commitments. Summarizing European concerns in one question: would you trust Donald Trump?
Looking forward, we are no longer a reliable ally for another reason; our toxic partisan politics not only prevent rational debate, but prevent governance as well. The House has sent over 400 bills to the Senate. Thanks to the obstructionist leadership of Mitch McConnell, the Senate has not taken them up. How could Europeans rely on an ally whose government is so dysfunctional that it cannot enact laws? 
Face it, we stink.

Too bad.  The USA now supports Russia over NATO.. Every GOP member of the House and Senate, and the GOP base,  by their votes, support Putin over anything the USA says it believes in.   
Judge by results.

The world has been ruled by the Americans and the Europeans from the last three hundred years or so. They have made the rules and shared the spoils. There is a slight problem between them about sharing. It will solve itself.  It always does.  That is  a very minor issue. They have sold to the rest of the world a bill of goods, democracy, rule of law, human rights, free trade. It is becoming very difficult to sell all that, when every day you see a lady let us call her the daughter of the east, is being paraded in a ankle bracelet. There was a time when you could do that with impunity.  You could sell them opium and call it free trade. And you did  all that. Times change. Now the world want to see a daughter of the west let us call her a garment vendor adorned with a ankle bracelet. Remember the rule of law and all that. The problem is the west is not ready for that. That is a major problem. But that is how the cookie crumbles. Amrit

Given the economic power of these United States, Europe may not have a choice...but trust it in a distant future again, once the main culprit of it's deceit, a vulgar bully in the Oval Office, is gone.
It's just the end of trust in American global leadership. no biggie.

As bad as all this is...the hyperbole and hand-wringing here is a bit silly. If you look at the last 100 or so, all the countries involved have betrayed one another in much more fundamental ways than anything Trump has done. 

Nobody trusts anybody in international politics to begin with. Trump is an infected boil, and if he's lanced, people will quickly decide to pretend like the whole thing never happened. "Ever again" is a very long time to be talking about.

Ivan Krastev makes some very telling points. No sentient human being would deny that Trump has made some appalling foreign policy decisions. 

But Krastev utterly misses what is most important of all. Whether intentionally or in a fit of pique or absence of mind, Trump has done Europe and the world the greatest favor since the US recused Europe from axis domination last century. 

As Krastev says, apparently without grasping its significance, "[Europeans] have finally started to realize that a proper European Union foreign policy cannot be based on who is in the White House."

About bloody time!!! For too long, the US umbrella has protected the Europeans from the results of their own irresponsibility. Take Germany. It has promised to raise its military spending to the agreed-on goal of 2% of GDP .... by 2030! Don't tell me that these parasites don't deserve a kick in the pants.

Let's hope that Trump has opened Europeans' eyes to the danger of entrusting its security to ... leaders like Trump. 

All the recent US presidents laid end to end haven't an achievement like Trump's to their names. It is not just Europe. It took Trump to call out China on its predatory trade policies. No matter who wins the next election, our relations with China will never be the same unless China begins to live up to its responsibilities as a major trading partner. Even the news from North Korea is night-and-day better than Obama's legacy to the world. 

Europe most of all owes Trump its thanks.

I truly believe that after Trump, it will be a long time before Europe or any of our Allies will trust the US again; but we might stand a chance of shorting the reluctance should a democrat or Independent win the 2020 election. As things stand right now, should Trump or another republican win the 2020 election, or any presidential election far into the future, the US will be hard pressed to find Allies willing to fight with us and for us should the US ever be attacked again, because the republicans have shown their true colors and have not stood up to their President. Putin has used flattery and pomp to court Trump in order to destroy NATO, American influence, and to undermine the US with our Allies, and this imbecile of a president has taking it hook, line and sinker!!!
Until the corporations are out of politics, and we have term limits on congressional placements I'm not sure anyone can trust this country...

commentBody: I’m a perfect example of the point you’re making, only starting from the American perspective: My wife and I have decided, based on everything that’s happened in the US over the past few years, to move permanently to France. As a newly-minted European, I wouldn’t trust the US in the years ahead, either, and for one very good reason: Trump is the symptom, not the cause, of a serious contraction in the US’ world leadership. Republicans' embrace of Putin’s false narrative about election meddling (as an example) is the result of about 40% of the country blindly go along with widely debunked conspiracy theories, and those people aren’t going away even after Trump is gone—whether through impeachment or at the ballot box. There's no small irony that today’s GOP seems to ignore the fact that the single most important element of national (and, thus, global) security for the US is to have a healthy workforce and economy, and despite record stock-market numbers recently, the long-term prospects are gloomy. This article explains why: America is not the land of the free but one of monopolies so predatory they imperil the nation https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2019/dec/01/america-is-not-the-land-of-the-free-but-one-of-monopolies-so-predatory-they-imperil-the-nation The good news is, if you’re a European (Brexit issue aside), things actually look quite a bit better long-term here. I’m optimistic, anyway—that’s my natural state.

commentBody:
No.  Europe should not continue to trust the US to underwrite its national security.  It's about time they start actually contributing like real allies, real partners, to a pact of mutual security.  

That means, at a minimum, finally spending the percentage of GDP on their military mandated by NATO, which has been treated merely as a nice suggestion by France and Germany, among others, for decades.   

When the Balkans war broke out in the '90s, threatening to swamp Europe with refugees, the Europeans were utterly helpless to stop a tin pot dictator a mere two hour flight from Rome without the US doing the heavy lifting.  Same with Libya during Obama's administration.  Disgraceful. 

Why in the world did we start expanding NATO right up to Moscow's doorstep after the fall of the Berlin Wall? I can understand wanting to bring little ex-Soviet bloc countries into our socio-economic orbit, but does making Estonia and Latvia NATO members do anything but add more helpless dependents to the "alliance"? All it does is make is more likely that American troops will fight the Russians.  

We do not have a mutual security alliance with Europe.  We have a dysfunctional relationship.

Foreign relations were sorely overlooked by most Americans during the 2016 debacle. It was clear that Trump's ignorant and simplistic stance was a recipe for disaster. His five-cent head is unfortunately altering seventy years of a functioning and stable alliance. Even the Bush/Cheney cabal was smart enough to realize how critical this alliance is to the stability of the world.

The United States is returning to its roots as a plantation state. Not physically, but intellectually. 

A plantation state can only succeed when large numbers of people accept its underlying fiction. They accept absurdities, and in doing so learn to commit atrocities. 

However, their acceptance is visible from the outside, as is their choice of President. Few would care to trust them.

By my calculations the trade deficit the U.S. has with the E.U.  is substantially more than enough to pay for the trade deficit that the E.U. has with China.  We also pay 70% of the cost of NATO.  What NATO countries spend 3.5% of GDP on defense like the U.S.?  None. Lucky if they spend 2%.  And then they put trade barriers on our goods and fine our technology companies billions.  We don't need Europe, or their sorry, overpriced cars (Scotty Kilmer).  Few people despise Donald Trump more than I do,  but he is right when it comes to trade.  The U.S. has been suckered for decades,  and Wall Street and corporate America are unwilling to endure short term pain for long term gain.  Indeed, they love globalism more than they do their own country.  Too bad!

Europe has a bad habit of free-loading off of America while hectoring her.  For example, the NATO Charter has called for all member nations to pay 2% of GDP to their defense.  Nobody but the Brits ever has come close.  Sure, they talk about it ... actually, they talk about convening talks about developing a framework to develop a joint communique ... yada yada yada.  But as long as America is covering their defense, they can spend that money on social programs while hectoring us for being backwards for not doing the same.

Then there is the silence on human rights abuses across the globe.  Where are the Europeans on the Uighars, or Hong Kong, or the Rhohinga?  Sure, they are happy to bad-mouth Israel and cut deals with the mullahs.  But they are no friend of freedom.

Heck, the Germans were building the Russians a natural gas pipeline even after the Russians turned off gas to nations that supported Ukraine.

The French joined NATO, but not the military part.  Without the military part, what is the point?  Why should we have NATO/OTAN (in French) if they don't fully participate?

Then, there was the "60 Minutes" piece after the fall of the Berlin Wall where the French government gave their highest honor to their outgoing intelligence chief for re-orienting their intel community away from the Russians and going all-in on industrial espionage against the U.S.

I like Europe.  But I don't trust them.

Europe was worried about W. Bush, who called them old Europe for not being our ride or die buddies (well, UK was, but France found us eating freedom fries).  Then Obama came in and won a Nobel Prize for not being W.  Then, whiplash, we voted in Trump, the guy who doesn't seem to think that cuddling Russia is a problem.  Maybe Europe has learned what we should.  W and Trump are not outliers, but manifestations of our internal problems that aren't going away.   We should see that no one would trust us if we 180 every 8 years.  But we don't.  We are in for it.  We need to stop looking at Europe like a greedy entourage we are better for shaking off and start seeing them as allies against a return of expansionist forces.  (Yes, I'm waving at you, Russia!  I guess Tim Cook hasn't convinced me that Crimea should be yours yet.) We need to help Europe because a healthy Europe is in our best interests.  Nah!  Don't mind me.  History doesn't mimic itself!  Human nature has fundamentally changed in the last 75 years!  Right?  Nothing to worry about.  Let's find something fun to watch instead of that boring old impeachment show and convince ourselves this is all normal.
Maybe if we rebuff Trump and his party next November. Otherwise he's not trustworthy, so why would anyone trust him?

It’s what?  Over 74 years since the end of WWII.  There is no longer a Soviet Union or its Warsaw Pact. Why is there still a NATO?  An organization that was founded a shield against a Soviet threat that no longer exists.  Why are we still giving “War Guarantees” to nations that don’t represent our interests.  Wish the President would just go Full Monty here, and just end this NATO farce, which has cost American taxpayers $Billions for something that should have died a natural death at lest 25 years ago!

At reading some comments here, one can only think that the ignorance and dishonesty of some Americans are staggering.
Today the USA have invaded Europe with all their biggest corporations who are fiscally registered there and not in the USA.
Apple, Amazon, Facebook, Yahoo, Google, Starbucks, Netflix and others are all in Ireland or Luxembourg hiding into multiple fake fiduciaries to cheat and pay zero taxes while stealing all business, stealing advertising, stealing private data of European citizens without asking them and without respecting the Europeans laws of privacy.
They use the infrastructures but don't participate in investment or maintenance and more so they don't pay into the participation based European economy which relies on free health care and free education for all up to university.
Then they hire European software engineers because they have better education than Americans.
The US corporations repatriate the cash via London as the main laundry machine and to the US offshore banks in the Caribbean which are only legal for the USA . See Panama papers.
Without talking about the destruction of the European economy by US corps, they by themselves inflict a 20 % fiscal fraud and deficit on the EU annual budget.
Then they reinvest the stolen cash into speculation aimed at destroying the economic balance of Europe but also South America and the Middle East  .

commentBody: Mr. Krastev's  piece attempts to describe a sea-change in Europe's attitude towards the USA. I'm not so sure about that. Proclaiming that Europe should have an independent foreign policy is to argue form over substance. The US has always- the current occupant of the White House excepted- had good relations, economic and political, with other democratic countries. That means most of Europe, particularly following the fall of the Soviet Union, and it is this shared value system that leads to a similarity in policy as much as anything else. We act in concert with each other because think alike. Once the US finishes its dangerous and destructive four years with you-know-who, the hope is that our country will return to something we recognize as the country we grew up in. We broke it- electing The Donald- so we have to be the ones to fix it. Once that happens, we will have to have an approach to the rest of the world along the lines of, "Can we talk?" There is much re-affirmation of policy and goals, largely shared under all previous administrations, to be discussed. After the madness of the last four years, it will be a welcome, and needed, change for everyone.

commentBody: Unfortunately, he's right.  We can't be trusted anymore.  And we have done it all to ourselves.
